qas.question: What is the area in the pacific known for heavy volcanic activity?
The Pacific Ring of Fire contains what percentage of the earthquakes on Earth?
Which Hawaiin volcano has been erupting since 1983?
When was the last time that the Hawaiin islands experienced a life threatening volcanic eruption?
What year did Mt St. Helens erupt causing devastating damage?
What is the source of 80% of the world's earthquakes?
What Hawaiian volcano has been erupting since 1985?
When was the first time the Hawaiian Islands experienced a life-threatening volcanic eruption?

plausible_answers.text: active volcanoes in the United States

qas.question: The American Southwest sees the highest concentration of what?

context: The West Coast of the continental United States and areas of Alaska (including the Aleutian Islands, the Alaskan Peninsula and southern Alaskan coast) make up part of the <a0_0><b6_0>Pacific Ring of Fire<a0_0/>,<b6_0/> an area of heavy tectonic and volcanic activity that is the source of <a1_0>90%<a1_0/> of the world's earthquakes.[citation needed] The American Northwest sees the highest concentration of <b9_0>active volcanoes in the United States<b9_0/>, in Washington, Oregon and northern California along the Cascade Mountains. There are several active volcanoes located in the islands of Hawaii, including <a2_0><b7_0>Kilauea<b7_0/><a2_0/> in ongoing eruption since 1983, but they do not typically adversely affect the inhabitants of the islands. There has not been a major life-threatening eruption on the Hawaiian islands since the <a3_0><b8_0>17th century<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Volcanic eruptions can occasionally be devastating, such as in the <a4_0>1980<a4_0/> eruption of <b5_0>Mount St. Helens<b5_0/> in Washington.
